evidence_span: Cold-worked Z$_\Gamma$-2.5 Nb tube lengths had been supplied by Wolverine from a cast containing 2.6 Nb and 1100-ppm 02

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_026_chunk1
evidence_span: During manufacture this tubing had been given a final reduction of ~75 percent followed by a heat treatment of 515°C for 6 h

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_026_chunk1
evidence_span: cold-worked Zircaloy-2 tubing went through a similar manufacturing route, but while most of it was finally heat treated for 6 h at 515°C, a proportion of the tube lengths were heat treated for only 5 h at 475°C

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_026_chunk1
evidence_span: a proportion of the tube lengths were heat treated for only 5 h at 475°C

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_026_chunk1
evidence_span: Typical RT tensile properties of the tubing treated at 515°C are as follows. Ultimate Tensile Strength (psi X 103) 95 106 Cold-worked Zircaloy-2 Cold-worked Zr-Nb alloy

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_026_chunk1
evidence_span: Typical RT tensile properties of the tubing treated at 515°C are as follows. Ultimate Tensile Strength (psi X 103) 95 106 Cold-worked Zircaloy-2 Cold-worked Zr-Nb alloy

evidence_span: Some of the Zr-Nb tubing was water quenched from 890°C and then tempered 72 h at 500°C

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_026_chunk5
evidence_span: The author has reported the failure of a cold-worked Zr-2.5Nb tube at 1.8 percent hoop strain. This specimen failed between 0 and 3440 h so that the creep rate must have been 5 × 10^-6 per h or greater.

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_026_chunk5
evidence_span: Coleman² has shown that at a creep rate of 5 × 10^-6 per h for cold-worked Zr-2.5Nb, in-reactor, the stress exponent of creep rate, n, is about 10

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_026_chunk5
evidence_span: at 10 × 10^-6 per h, n increases to about 100

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_026_chunk5
evidence_span: Stress-rupture tests on cold drawn Zr-2.5Nb, quenched and aged Zr-2.5Nb, and cold drawn Zircaloy-2 (out-ofpile uniaxial) showed that rupture ductility can be correlated with n the lower n, the higher the ductility³

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_026_chunk5
evidence_span: Stress-rupture tests on cold drawn Zr-2.5Nb, quenched and aged Zr-2.5Nb, and cold drawn Zircaloy-2 (out-ofpile uniaxial) showed that rupture ductility can be correlated with n the lower n, the higher the ductility³

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_026_chunk5
evidence_span: Stress-rupture tests on cold drawn Zr-2.5Nb, quenched and aged Zr-2.5Nb, and cold drawn Zircaloy-2 (out-ofpile uniaxial) showed that rupture ductility can be correlated with n the lower n, the higher the ductility³

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_026_chunk5
evidence_span: A change of n from 10 to 100 reduces ductility by a factor of about 5

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_026_chunk5
evidence_span: Wood has two tube tests and Coleman has two uniaxial tests inreactor on cold drawn Zr-2.5Nb which have shown 4 to 5 percent strain without failure

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_026_chunk5
evidence_span: Wood has two tube tests and Coleman has two uniaxial tests inreactor on cold drawn Zr-2.5Nb which have shown 4 to 5 percent strain without failure

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_026_chunk5
evidence_span: demonstrated high ductility inreactor of Zircaloy-2

page_or_fig: Suppression of Void Formation in Zirconium
evidence_span: Voids have been found in most irradiated metals and alloys of cubic structure

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_026_chunk5
page_or_fig: Suppression of Void Formation in Zirconium
evidence_span: In hexagonal close-packed metals, there have been some recent observations of voids in cobalt and α-zirconium after irradiation by energetic ions or electrons

source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_026_chunk5
page_or_fig: Suppression of Void Formation in Zirconium
evidence_span: In neutron irradiated hexagonal metals, however, voids have been found in magnesium and rhenium but not in α-zirconium, Zircaloy-2, and α-titanium
